interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Right Stuff (Two-Disc Special Edition)
Review Date: 2011/11/28
Store: Scott Glenn  (Actor),     Ed Harris  (Actor),     Philip Kaufman  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Fully Loaded DVDs, Special Editions
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Right Stuff, The: Special Edition (Dbl DVD)', "In the middle of the 20th century, America pondered its future - and looked to the skies. Based on Tom Wolfe's book, The Right Stuff is the tale of how that future began, a thrilling epic of intrepid test pilot Chuck Yeager and the seven pioneering astronauts of the Project Mercury space program. Philip Kaufman scripts and directs, pushing the envelope with a filmmaking bravado that matches this soaring story of training and heroism; and of sudden fame for which there is no training. Ed Harris, Barbara Hershey, Sam Shepard, Dennis Quaid and Fred Ward are among the perfect cast of this winner of 4 Academy Awards* that in a pristine 20th-anniversary digital transfer remains the stuff of must-see entertainment. Let's light this candle, flyboys!", ']]>', 'Set Contains:', "For the film's 20th anniversary, a new two-disc edition replaces the original bare-bones DVD. The film looked pretty good on the old disc, but there is more depth to the remastered soundtrack and better yet, you don't need to flip the disc to view the entire film. The second disc of extras is well done, but a bit light. There are 20-minute commentaries from director Philip Kauffman and another track of many actors' fond reminisces of working on the film. They are so engaging it's odd to think there wasn't enough to do a complete commentary track, or even two. A newly produced three-part documentary looks at the project from Tom Wolfe's book to screenplay, the making-of the movie, and interviews with the real participants of the saga. Again, the running time (45 minutes) feels too short. The 13 additional scenes, sans set-up, are really pieces from the cutting-room floor but curiously interesting. The bulk of the extras is the 90-minute PBS program on the life and times of John Glenn, aired around the time of--and mostly about--his second trip into space in 1998. The DVD extras could have used an outside voice--or historian or film critic--to give an objective viewpoint to this outstanding film.", '--Doug Thomas']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Color, Dolby, Closed-captioned, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, WidescreenMultiple Formats, Anamorphic, Color, Dolby, Closed-captioned, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen  See more', 'Contributor': 'Pamela Reed, Irwin Winkler, Barbara Hershey, Philip Kaufman, Donald Moffat, Kathy Baker, Veronica Cartwright, Kim Stanley, Dennis Quaid, Lance Henriksen, Sam Shepard, Tom Wolfe, Fred Ward, Scott Glenn, Robert Chartoff, Scott Wilson, Ed HarrisPamela Reed, Irwin Winkler, Barbara Hershey, Philip Kaufman, Donald Moffat, Kathy Baker, Veronica Cartwright, Kim Stanley, Dennis Quaid, Lance Henriksen, Sam Shepard, Tom Wolfe, Fred Ward, Scott Glenn, Robert Chartoff, Scott Wilson, Ed Harris  See more', 'Initial release date': '2005-12-13', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 5.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2232393', 'Director': 'Philip Kaufman', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Color, Dolby, Closed-captioned, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '3 hours and 13 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 13, 2005', 'Actors': 'Scott Glenn, Ed Harris, Barbara Hershey, Dennis Quaid, Pamela Reed', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Robert Chartoff, Irwin Winkler', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Philip Kaufman, Tom Wolfe', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: This is a very good DVD that covers the early space test and exploration. If you like space stuff you will truly enjoy it very much.Would recommend to my friends.
Review Title: Great DVD
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

The Fugitive: The Fourth and Final Season, Volume Two
David Janssen  (Actor),     Barry Morse  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Drama
['Dr. Richard Kimble is accused to be the murder of his wife. The night before his execution, he escapes. The only chance to prove his innocence is to find the man who killed his wife. Kimble, persecuted by the Lt. Gerard, risks his life several times when he shows his identity to help other people out of trouble.']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Product Preference**: The user continues to prioritize music-related content and has shown a growing interest in high-quality drama series, emphasizing a wide appreciation for compelling narratives across various formats.

- **Genre Affinity**: The user remains committed to musicals and performing arts while actively exploring themes related to history and exploration through captivating drama, indicating a desire for entertainment that is both inspiring and thought-provoking.

- **Quality Expectation**: There is a sustained emphasis on high-quality products and timely delivery. Recent interactions reinforce the user's preference for well-produced content with significant historical narratives, further solidifying their expectations for excellence in both service and product quality.

- **Shopping Behavior**: Loyalty to platforms that consistently provide satisfactory experiences is evident, as demonstrated by repeat purchases driven by positive quality and delivery experiences, particularly for items that enrich their interests in both music and dramatic storytelling.

- **Rating Tendencies**: The user is proactive in providing feedback, frequently granting high ratings for products that exceed expectations in quality and delivery, showcasing a commitment to endorsing exceptional experiences.

- **Media Format**: The user values diverse media formats while prioritizing high production standards and immersive storytelling, reflecting a flexible and discerning approach to both physical and digital content.

Overall, the user exhibits a passion for superior entertainment, a preference for dependability in service, and a tendency to reaffirm their positive experiences through generous reviews and ratings.
